description: Dopamine (DA, C6H3(OH)2-CH2-CH2-NH2) is an organic chemical of the catecholamine and phenethylamine families that plays several important roles in the brain and body. It is an amine synthesized by removing a carboxyl group from a molecule of its precursor chemical L-DOPA. Dopamine present in a wide variety of animals, including both vertebrates and invertebrates.
name: Dopamine Antibodies and Antigens
